column1: fullish, sliding into the pads, 131kph and Guptill skims a leg glance wide of the man on the edge of the ring, Billy Stanlake can't get his rig moving quickly enough and that's a boundary off the first ball
length, around fourth stump, met on the front foot but checked into the covers
touch shorter, 135kph and nibbling in to his the knee roll as Guptill hangs back - high? Maybe heading down
length ball, too straight and Guptill works the ball in front of square, deep square leg has to come across and they trundle through for two
some away swing for Richardson, too wide to begin with
fired down the leg side this time
back of a length around ff stump, defended towards backward point
pitched up and Guptill stretches forward, thick edge in the aiiiiiiirrrrrrrr... but it whizzes past backward point and runs all the way for four more!
shaping in, good pace on a length, Munro takes it through midwicket this time, picks up three from his first ball
oh, nicely done! Cheeky from Guppy, rocking back and using the pace, ramping four over guilly
touch shorter, 148kph and it's on him quickly, defended down... just past off stump!
pitched up in the channel and Guptill launches a drive, backing away and freeing the arms, struck firmly but straight to mid-off
length, 147kph outside off, dabbed towards backward point
down the ground, smashed for the first six! Guptill is motoring straight away, carves himself a chunk of Stanlake pie - quickly on to the bat and quickly back over long-off, flat and hard
another boundary! Bit of luck this time, Munro forcing at the ball away from his body and thick-edging past his stumps
slower ball, Munro skips down and flails at it without connecting
short ball, 133kph, sits up to be thwacked on the pull, one to deep square leg
pitched up, Guptill swings hard, comes off the inside of the bat to midwicket
slightly leg side and it's deflected off the hip
short ball, Munro swipes at it - and nearly plays on again! Edged a whisker past off stump, Carey does well to prevent it slipping past him for another streaky four
length, touching 149kph and Guptill mistimes an aggressive mow
sweet potato pie, that's massive! Pitched up and hammered way back over the sightscreen, a real golf swing, straight as a die into the stands
goes very short, trampoline bounce over the crouching batsman
sort ball, Guptll was backing away and had to punch a pull away square
full and POW! Munro now spanks Stanlake down the ground, looked like it might go straight to mid-off but there was enough biff on the shot to clear the man, one-bounce four!
angled across and spiked into the covers, Stoinis takes the pace off it
was that a drop? Munro rather chipped a drive back towards the bowler, Tye looked frustrated to have missed it... went straight through the hands
taking the pace off, prodded into a gap
length, wobbly around off, Munro dinks it down the ground
here he goes again! Cross-seam ball from Tye, he makes a bit of room and splats it over long-off, another easy, breezy swing of the arms - that's the NZ 50 up, from just 28 balls!
short, stays back and attempts the ramp, fails to connect
slower ball but it's leg side and Guptill has scooped it over short fine leg! Audacious, gets under it, skips away to the rope again! NZ are flying
pitched up and lashed towards wide long-off, almost goes for six! Skidding on cross-seam, Munro just bullies through the line, towards the longest part of the ground
shortish, dabbed down behind square
length, on the pads, Munro brings out his axe and lumberjacks four more to deep backward square leg
banged in, climbing through well over the batsman's head
short of a length, 135kph and jabbed into the midwicket area for one
back of a length outside off, toe-ended into the covers
angled in with the arm and Guptill flicks a single to keep the strike
round the wicket, pushed through and chopped towards backward point
darted flat, touch short but Guptill just prods it into the midwicket gap for one
flat on the stumps, into Munro's arc and mowed over wide long-on! Flat-batted whack and it sails over the ropes!
tossed up outside off, bludgeoned down the ground to long-off for one
fired in, Guptill rocks back and heaves a pull to deep midwicket
pushed through quickly outside leg stump, Munro looks to give it some more pongo over midwicket, but is hit on the pad
on the stumps, worked into a gap leg side
speared in full, 135kph and Munro can only dig it out towards midwicket
slower ball, pushed across the bows, Munro slashes like Freddy Krueger and it comes off the toe, beats the diving Carey and Stanlake can't reel it in in front of third man
full on the pads, whipped fine for one
short ball, sits up to be slugged in front of deep midwicket, Maxwell cuts it off in front of the rope
wicket-to-wicket stuff, chopped through the leg side
fired in flat outside leg stump, swung away fine for one
pushed through on leg and tickled off the pads
tossed up and crrrrrrrrrrruuuuuuuuuuuunched into the crowd over long-on! This was fast, almost looked like a medium-pace delivery, Munro just whacked it back in the direction whence it came
pushed back to the bowler
pushed through and heaved leg side, into a gap at deep midwicket for a couple
floated up and swiped down the ground for one to long-on
pushed through and worked back down the ground for one
tick, tick, tick BOOM! Hits with the spin, nicely into range for the loose-limbed Guptil, who reaches out and slams over long-on - Guptil gets fifty and up comes the NZ 100, too!
looped up and swung away menacingly into the leg side
tossed up and smeared over long-off! Munro goes to fifty with a six, too! Clean drive through the line, almost into the second tier - never mind the small boundaries!
flat and sliding on with the arm, Munro swivels and slaps it past deep backward square for four!
punched down the ground, respite for Aus
into the crowd again! Munro stays still in the crease and creams it over long-on
length ball on the pads, Munro hits a flat six over backward square leg! This one does only just clear the rope...
three in a row!!! This one is massive! Swung over midwicket, goes about 15 rows back into the crowd, Tye being collared here

slogged down the ground... but this is pouched at long-on! Australia finally get their breakthrough, Maxwell running around to bag it safely. Didn't quite get hold of this one, Tye back off the canvas, bloodied but not beaten
on the stumps, punched back in the air, just wide of the bowler
hits his first ball for a Dorothy! Full outside off, Seifert steps into line and slots it over long-off, didn't hit it too hard and the ball just plops beyond the rope
back of a length, Guptill slugs it to leg
bowling round the wicket, speared in full, struck on the back leg... Umpire says no, think it just pitched outside leg stump
short ball but it's leg side, 143kph and pulled away fine for four, easy pickings
pitched up full on leg, Guptill flicked it away through backward square leg - and that's the record, most T20I runs for Guptill!
fired in and tapped down the ground
full and driven, towards long-off... who slips and lets it through for four more! Brings up the NZ 150 in the process
lobbed up leg side, slows the pace and Guptill seemed to glove that straight through the keeper, though hard to call it a chance
ooh, tries to get cute, going for a reverse-muller over backward point, doesn't get hold of it
tossed up and flicked firmly towards short fine leg, good fielding prevents it running away
angled in flat and worked for one

Agar baits the trap, and Seifert picks out deep square leg! Hitting towards the longer part of the ground, against the spin and the connection wasn't good, sailed down the throat of Finch, who holds it safely
pushed through on middle and leg, Guptill settles for a prod to long-on
short of a length, 130 kays and pulled flat through midwicket

short ball, pulled into his thigh pad and Chapman wants one, is sent back wisely but Guptill... and Stoinis misses with a toe-end dink towards the stumps with the batsman trying to regain his ground! Think he would just have made it
full outside off, 131kph and punched to long-off along the baize
full toss on leg, bunted through midwicket for one more
short ball, Chapman pulls it to deep midwicket - only singles off this Stoinis over so far
another full toss and Guptill smokes it over wide long-off to finish the over with another six! Quite a wide line, full extension of the arms, just levered into the boundary boards
pitched up wide of off, chopped through the covers
good bowling, full on off, 132kph and Guptill can only jam down on it
full, taking the pace off, but he's missed the blockhole and Guptill hammers it into the stands! Another full-fat smack down the ground, well back over long-on
short and wide, sits back and cuts, sends it screaming into a gap, four to deep backward point this time!

length ball, Guptill <del>quietly taps into the covers and straightens his collar</del> pings it back over the head of long-on for six more! Didn't connect cleanly with this but the Eden Park boundaries ensure the fielder isn't in business here
short ball, pulled without timing through backward square leg
swung high and handsome over cow corner! Puts it on a length and Guptill puts it into the stand again, moves to within a blow of his hundred!

short now, Guptill swings savagely, lands the ball on the rope at long-on - that's his century, from 49 balls! Second T20I hundred for Guppy. Think it was a slower ball but it went pretty quickly to the fence, even though he was off balance
full and swatted into the covers
on the stumps, Chapman swings a single through midwicket
full and straight, well bowled, Guptill digs out one through midwicket - raises the NZ 200, with more than four overs to go!
dropped! Short ball, Chapman picks out deep square leg on the pull... and Finch shells it! He made the ground, should have caught it but the ball hit the fingers and went down
full ball, Chapman scuttles across his stumps, ramps it fine for four! Piling on the agony
full, taking the pace off, chopped for one
angled across, misses the tramlines
pitched up and swatted towards mid-off, Maxwell's throw is errant
fired in full, Guptill was backing away, chopped between his legs - audacious, brings out the 'Natmeg', Stanlake does well to prevent four
fired wide of the off-side line

got him, slogged into the leg side! Guptill finally plinks one short of the rope, Tye gets another, although it was close to being a no-ball... Swung towards deep midwicket from high on the bat and Maxwell again takes the catch coming in off the rope
full outside off, gets a swing and a miss
sliding across the left-hander, who slices a couple wide of this man
full and straight and swung high to leg, into a gap but just one
goes round the wicket, slides a full ball down the leg side
pitched up, flicked firmly off the pads in front of deep midwicket, Stoinis pulls of a good sliding stop on the fence
slower delivery, bowled it well and Chapman is duped swinging hard outside off
short. 140kph and mistimed on the pull down the ground
back of a length, taking the pace off again and De Grandhomme takes it on the body trying to swing up and over fine leg

oof, that's a blow on the helmet - and it's knocked clean off his head and into the stumps! Very unfortunate for Chapman, he's unhurt but he is out... Reminiscent of Pietersen getting out against WI a decade ago, the helmet slipped straight off his head and bounced into the wicket. Stanlake strikes, closing out a decent over
squirted into the leg side, Maxwell misfields as he attempts to fire in the throw and they come back for two

bowled 'im! De Grandhomme clears the front leg but is done by the slower ball, thick-edges into his back leg and on to the stumps! Another wicket at the death, Richardson snaffles the dangerous Bigman
slower ball again, dabbed square for one
pitched up and heaved into the leg side, they think better of coming for two
full outside off, Williamson chips it to long-off running in! Completely mistimed, think it was a slower ball again from Richardson, floated up and plopped down the ground, Tye taking it well
well bowled again, swatted for one by Taylor
short ball, swung away to square leg on the pull
knuckleball, deceives Wheeler and bounces over he stumps
pitched up and whacked down the ground for one

dropped! Full toss, muscled towards deep square leg, but Short puts down a straightforward catch! There's then a run-out chance as he fires in the throw but Taylor dives for the line and makes it safely

length ball, heaved into the leg side, beyond the rope... and it's been snagged by an orange-clad fella in the crowd! A brilliant one-handed catch, and he goes bananas, because it's worth NZ$50,000, I believe! The Aussies should get him in the team
slung wide of the stumps as Taylor steps down
again Tye loses his line, into the tramlines and he'll have to bowl it again
full toss to finish and Taylor slugs it over the deep midwicket rope! The 18th six of the innings and it takes NZ up to a mighty 243-6 from their 20 overs!
short of a length outside off, pulled firmly to mid-on
fuller, outside off, touch of swing and heaved into the leg side without much timing
full at leg stump, takes the pad into the leg side
that's a very short one outside off, climbs over the keeper
well bowled, a full one outside off, Short jabs at it and is beaten by some late swing...Boult thinks he's nicked it, screams an appeal. He's the only one interested
clipped to the left of mid-on
there's the first boundary, punches a back-of-a-length delivery clean over mid-off
full at off stump, 141kph, swung into the leg side and finds midwicket
that's a thick outside to third man for six! A full delivery outside off, Short throwing his hands through a drive
and this time it's an inside edge past the stumps...aiming to go through midwicket against a length delivery and it scoots past the keeper
another edge, another boundary! Not a day to be a bowler...back of a length on off stump, touch of swing, Short aims into the leg side and gets an outside edge to third man
a bouncer, he ducks...it's borderline on height, gets away with it
bottom hand comes into play as he whips this from outside off over midwicket
short of a length on leg stump, Warner pulls it off his hip behind square
a touch fuller, at the stumps, heaves across the line and finds deep midwicket...rolled his fingers across it
full at middle and leg, flicked off the pads to deep midwicket
full at the stumps, pace off at 119kph, pushed into the covers
short outside leg stump, he goes for the pull and there's a slightly belated appeal for a catch down the leg side...given wide
dropped! That one was gloved. On leg stump again, Short goes for the pull and it takes the shoulder of the bat - maybe glove as well - but Seifert can't cling on diving to his right
and that rubs it in, another short one and this time it's pulled away wide of short fine leg
good length outside off, opens the face down to third man...Wheeler does well to cut it off
another inside edge! And it escapes to the rope...forcing off the back foot, ball shoots past leg stump
pushes a good-length ball to cover
gets the yorker in, at the stumps, dug out back to Boult
back of a length at 140kph, pulled to midwicket...three dots in a row quite something in this match
that goes wrong, a full toss slips down the leg side...Short might feel he missed out
full at off stump, clipped to deep square leg and it's placed well enough for the second...good over from Boult
swings and a miss against a back-of-a-length ball
into the crowd (but not caught this time)...another short ball, this time Warner latches on and clears deep square leg
drags this down the leg side, another wide
another extra ball as a full delivery is pushed down the leg side, trying to cramp Warner for room
over the straight boundary, a back-of-a-length ball which he swings off the front foot over mid-on
full at off stump, pushed through the covers
another wild short one, the wheel(ers) are a little off for New Zealand at the moment...goes for the bouncer, sails over Short and the keeper
back on a length, pulled to deep square leg
aims for the yorker, it's a low full toss at off stump, not a bad delivery, driven along the ground to long-off...22 off that over
full and straight, driven to mid-off on the edge of the circle
short on leg stump, pulled effortlessly off his hip and it's a fraction in front of the rope
gives himself room outside leg and drives a full delivery down the ground
that's ridiculous! He's chipped it for six, barely any power. All timing. A full delivery, a little flick of the wrists sends it over mid-off
goes short, Warner opts to try to go through the off side, moves to leg and it beaten over the top edge...clever change of pace
over the leg side, into the second tier! Short, pulled over deep square leg...91 off the Powerplay!
full outside off, may have been the googly, takes a thick edge towards short third man...and there's an overthrow after a wild return
short, straight, pulled to deep square leg
full outside leg stump, clipped to short fine leg
short outside off, another wrong 'un, worked out to deep midwicket
a dot ball, a precious thing...trying to take a full delivery from outside off through the leg side
touch shorter, flatter, worked through the leg side and more good placement brings a brace
short outside leg stump, basically a long hop, pulled powerfully wide of deep square leg
over corrects, goes very full and wide outside off
miscues through the leg side, doesn't quite carry to deep square leg...bit of a fumble by Munro
jeepers, it's tough tonight...full outside off, Warner gets a thick outside wide of the keeper to take him to a 20-ball fifty
good length at the stumps, pushed wide of cover
round the wicket, that's almost conventional cricket, good length at off stump and tapped into point with an open face
short outside off, loses his shape as he has a mighty swing, loops off the top edge over point and lands safely
drags a shortish ball from outside off to deep midwicket
back of a length, stand-and-deliver from Warner, shifts his front leg out of the way and clubs it over long-on
done him! Beaten all ends up. Very nicely bowled. A googly, think Warner read it, went back to pull but was through his shot a fraction early and the ball takes the top of off stump
full and straight, another googly, takes a thick inside edge into the leg side
cut to deep cover
good length at off stump, Lynn comes forward and pushes into point with an open face
gets a bottom edge into his pads as he aims to heave through the leg side
a low full toss, he's not hit it that cleanly, but it sails into the crowd over long-off
pulled to deep square leg
round the wicket, flicks a length delivery one bounce to deep square leg

dropped! What a moment that could be...Martin Guptill at deep cover. Well bowled by de Grandhomme, a slower ball into the surface, Lynn couldn't get the distance over the off side but a pretty simple chance is shelled
carves a full toss over the off side, Guptill fields this cleanly and there's nearly a mix-up over a second run
an appeal for lbw as he misses a sweep, probably struck outside the line and spinning to miss off stump
a short delivery, clubbed along the ground to deep midwicket
a googly outside off, worked into the leg side...half-century off 30 balls
turn outside off, drives and misses...called wide
full at the stumps, gets a thick inside edge into his boot
full and straight, hammered straight down the ground and the fielders didn't have a hope
that's well bowled, pulled the length back as Lynn came down the pitch, driven straight to cover...a good over from Sodhi in the context of this match
taken at deep cover this time! Full outside off, jabbed out over the side, it's a skimming shot, reaches Guptill in a hurry and this time he holds on
a length ball gets swing into the stands at deep square leg...into a hospitality box
very wide outside off, barely on the cut strip...New Zealand have offered up too many extras
length ball outside off, driven sweetly to long-off
full and straight, clipped off the toes into midwicket
full at off stump, punched with a straight bat over long-on
the placement excellent again, pulls a short ball behind square...they just keep going
and is sent into the stands, a length ball, Maxwell clears the front leg and deposits it over long-on
moves outside leg again, short of a length, goes over cover this time, wide of the sweeper and just in front of the rope
what happened there?! Somehow it's got to third. A sharp bouncer, Maxwell is actually trying to let it go by ducking, leaves the bat up and it glances off the face
a dot ball! Full outside off, played back to the bowler
full and straight, inside edge into the pads and it rebounds towards backward point
short at off stump, pulled to deep square leg
round the wicket, full and straight, pushed to long-on
well bowled, gets the yorker in at leg stump, hammers into Short's boot
a short ball is costly, angled into the body, pulled around the corner and is down to fine leg in the blink of an eye
back to full and straight, a low full toss, down to long-on
what a shot, brilliant from Maxwell...a slower short ball, he stands tall in the crease and ramps it down to third man
full at the stumps, they've worked in the over, driven to long-off
goes deep in the crease outside leg stump, dragged down short, pulled over deep midwicket
short again, this time it's not timed as well, pulled straighter down the ground off the toe end
a googly outside off, slapped to cover
outside off, opens the face and pushes square to the off side
well bowled! Beaten by a sharp leg-break which bounces as well, good take for Seifert but Maxwell keeps his foot behind the line as they check for the stumping
pulls a short delivery straight down the ground, one bounce to long-on
full, straight, drilled...and he almost holds the pose
chopped on! Southee rolls his fingers across this, Maxwell giving himself some room to open up the off side, into off stump
beaten first ball, trying to angle a length delivery down to third man...there is a huge appeal for caught behind by Southee. Seifert less excited. No review
driven down the ground to long-on
back of a length at off stump, takes a bottom edge and bobbles to the off side
short outside off, pulled to deep midwicket...good over for New Zealand
that's costly! A huge full toss, takes a big top edge as Finch swings across the line and it flies down to fine leg
oh dear, a full toss wide outside off, a free swing for Finch and he gets a thick edge past a diving wicketkeeper

it's all going badly wrong. Finds deep midwicket where it's taken, is it another no-ball for height?! They are checking it...this will be called again, over waist height. Wheeler is out of the attack after those two full tosses
full at off stump, drilled down to long-on and it's caught but won't count
round the wicket, a wide yorker outside off, calmly steered down to third man
top edge, and taken! A short ball, Short goes for the pull, it goes high in the air and Seifert has plenty of time to get around to short fine leg
lovely shot by Finch, Boult came round the wicket, was angling into the pads just a touch and it was flicked past short fine leg
that's just a nudge down the ground, full outside off and help over long-on with barely any fuss...a lot happened in that over
back of a length, misses an attempt pull and gets smack in the stomach
short of a length, helped behind square on the leg side
paddles another short delivery down to fine leg
gets underneath this pull but it lands well short of fine leg
excellent placement, back of a length outside off, chopped down to third man...the fielder was inside the circle
beaten this time as he tries to ramp a short ball to third man
full, wide outside off, driven to deep cover
a slower short ball, allows it to loop through to the keeper and gets the wide call
goes full, driven in the air into the leg side, lands between long-on and deep midwicket
steers a full delivery through point, as he made it back for the second? No, he hasn't! A few inches short. Seifert did well to gather the ball and get it back to the stumps
full, wide outside off, carved over point to the sweeper
that's the match! Finished, aptly, with another six...a full toss is drilled way back into the crowd at long-on
